meanings.sent1: The pathogenic bacteria made him sick.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study pathogenic organisms to understand how diseases spread.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenic virus decided to take a vacation in his body.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenic nature of gossip can spread like wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenic effects of pollution on the environment are alarming.

meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting the origin or development of a disease.
meanings.sent1: Her research focused on pathogenic factors in disease progression.
meanings.sent2: Understanding pathogenic processes is crucial for effective treatment.
meanings.sent3: The pathogenic theory of the common cold being caused by sneezing unicorns is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The pathogenic relationship between stress and illness is well-documented.
meanings.sent5: The pathogenic pathway of the virus through the body was illustrated in the presentation.
